revised_title: Radio Tracking at Winkfield: A Study of Orbital Analysis Techniques
semantic_tags: Space Tracking and Data Acquisition Network (STADAN)
tldr: The article discusses the process of radio tracking at Winkfield, a station in the U.S. National Aeronautics and Space Administration's (NASA) Space Tracking and Data Acquisition Network (STADAN). The station uses interferometry to measure the direction and position of satellites as a function of time. The article explains the equipment, methods, and techniques used for tracking and resolving ambiguities in the direction of satellite signals. It also covers the calibration process and the performance of the tracking system.
